instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dim green light no fan spin
threads.message:
i bought this Mac on eBay so I can learn how to fix macs. Issue is with the charger I have a faint green light and no fan spin. I ended up replacing <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> do to having a short.   Once I replaced the Ic I was able to get proper voltage. 

As as of now I have the following:

<CHIP>U6901</CHIP>: 3.42vdc pin5
<CHIP>U6900</CHIP>: 3.42vdc pin1
             3.42vdc pin 5
             3.41vdc pin 4

at this point I have no clue where to go next. Thanks in advance.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dim green light no fan spin
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> present and what is the exact voltage? Was this board already messed with? Ebay stuff is usually fucked up garbage.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dim green light no fan spin
threads.message: yea there seems to be some flux around the <CHIP>U6990</CHIP> area. As for <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> i am getting 3.472

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dim green light no fan spin
threads.message: PPBUS-G3H at 3.4V or PP3V42 at 3.42V? Make sure you are measuring the correct rail. Also as this board was messed with inspect everything for more evidence of tampering.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dim green light no fan spin
threads.message:
i check the board and found <CAPACITOR>C7518</CAPACITOR> broken in half. replace and now i get a solid green light and no fan spin. Man, im getting excited than im so close. Any advise on what to check next? 
*Note i plugged in the battery and it made the green light on the charger go dim again, but when i unplug it it shows bright

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dim green light no fan spin
threads.message: Again check 3V42 and PPBUS. If PPBUS is at least 12.23V then check <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> too.
